meanings.definition: A long-handled tool with two or three prongs, used for lifting and pitching hay or straw.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a pitchfork to lift the hay into the barn.
meanings.sent2: She grabbed the pitchfork to help with the farm work.
meanings.sent3: The pitchfork and the shovel had a race to see who could finish the job first.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a pitchfork, lifting her spirits to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The pitchfork gleamed in the sunlight, ready for another day of work.

meanings.definition: To lift or throw with a pitchfork.
meanings.sent1: He will pitchfork the hay onto the truck for transportation.
meanings.sent2: They pitchforked the leaves into a pile for easy disposal.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to pitchfork the salad ingredients into the bowl for a fun presentation.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter pitchforked through the room, bringing smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent5: The music pitchforked his emotions, stirring memories long forgotten.

meanings.definition: A pitchfork-shaped symbol used in music notation to indicate a change in pitch.
meanings.sent1: The composer added a pitchfork to the score to signal the change in melody.
meanings.sent2: The musician pointed to the pitchfork on the sheet music to guide the singers.
meanings.sent3: The pitchfork on the music sheet seemed to dance along with the notes.
meanings.sent4: Her voice soared like a bird taking flight at the sight of the pitchfork symbol.
meanings.sent5: The pitchfork symbol on the page seemed to jump out, demanding attention.
